AsEOfDqy0EgOg3qsGOATOA.text: Best breakfast in town! It's always busy on the weekends so you may have to wait for a table but it's worth it. Food is always fantastic and service is great!

m3C9kRvIxEOHRCAwb4BmfA.text: Not feeling like contending with all the dahn-tahn Burgh traffic that inexplicably seems terrified of the tunnel monster, we decided to go to the Robinson location. What a brilliant choice that turned out to be. Breakfast was AMAZING! It was literally a ton of food and I ate all of it. Ok, almost all of it. I had the Steel City Breakfast of Champs with a waffle instead of pancakes. I just wanted to taste everything. As always though, my eyes were bigger than my stomach. I mean this thing had eggs, bacon, a giant, tender piece of ham steak, home fries, toast and a humungous waffle with strawberries and whipped cream. Everything was delicious, cooked to order, and the service was fantastic. Our server was awesome. My boyfriend had a 4 egg meat-o-rama omelette with home fries and toast. The huge smile on his face said it all. The place was super busy, and this was on a Friday afternoon. I can only imagine how busy it is on the weekend. So keep that in mind. However, it's well worth the wait. If you haven't been there yet, definitely check it aht!!!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The Steel City Breakfast of Champs!!

4OhLVBXg41VOfsjSa_e_jA.text: Just spent 60 bucks for breakfast and it was terrible! Won't never ever be back.... I guess I should have drank the free beer.....

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Just spent 60 bucks for breakfast and it was terrible! I should have drank the free beer....

tQFGwdkkvoE61CZ53POdHA.text: We wanted to go to the original Deluca's but this was on our way out of town. Kind of a cool retro diner with good food. We ended up splitting the seafood omelet which was plenty for the two of us. To be honest the omelet was solid but nothing amazing.   I think if you're looking for a place to have a good breakfast this is as good as any. I think I might have to try some other items on the menu to bump up this original rating.. One more reason to head back to Pittsburgh.

k5QHDRXfE1zV97_ayDOWSw.text: I went there last weekend with one of my Bestfriends and it was truly amazing!!! I have been craving it all week.. Everything from the delicious chocolate chip pancakes to the coffee!! My biggest pet peeves is having terrible "fake" breakfast food but this did not dissapoint. The eggs were real, not the mediocre egg beaters and the crispy bacon wasn't too greasy or fatty. I cannot wait to go back! Truly great food and great service

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Another amazing meal at delucas!!!!

qf4Fq_zjdctcX4SIdbg_-w.text: Great food, great service and free beer! Seriously though, the best breakfast spot in Robinson!

O4bZTFORy38h1wnaBd0lvQ.text: Okay so we attempted to go to the strip district location but the line was so long we went to Pamela's instead which we loved! Check out my review of that place.  This place was in a shopping plaza so the wait was 15 mins at most. People say the food is the same as that on the strip but if that's the case I'm so happy we didn't wait in that line. We were underwhelmed. The food was average diner food. I love a good casual greasy spoon place but that place was absolutely nothing special. We wont be returning.

zRkaGtLvGHu0_2xIsPTVtg.text: First time here entire family's meals were outstanding.  I had gourmet bacon club and it was unbelievable.  My daughter ordered a cheeseburger and it was the size of a football.  We'll be back.

gZfQO098xU3BVIwmVDgJtA.text: Don't go here at lunch time.  Tried lunch once before and it was so-so.   Definitely not worth the price.  Tried to give it another chance today.    Hostess seated  us pretty quickly but no server to be found.   Ended up getting up and walking out.

eqxkql2i0qz7gpvmJSgL2g.text: Waiter was excellent Coffee was terrible, pancakes were just ok Specialty breakfast was ok as well

a7_SffzJLCesctjLcgVXLQ.text: Never been to the original (it is always a super long line, which probably means  good food).  But, the food is fantastic!  I love the selections and the different choices (kielbasa and crepes).  The service unfortunately, was pretty terrible.  The server reeked of smoke and our food was cold.  We told him and he just kind of ignored us.  If I had to guess, it is a new restaurant and it may take some time to get the kinks out.  I would definitely go back because the food makes up for the poor service.

9MtO9UQ935ep7GHYQrPRNg.text: I was very excited when I saw Delucas was opening in Robinson as I am always anxious for a delicious non-chain venue.  Two weeks ago my family went to DeLucas for breakfast.  We arrived at 830 am and beat the crowd.  Service was awful!  We waited 15 minutes before we asked what we wanted to drink.  We finally order and the food comes out staggered.  My two sons get their meals (pancakes) and my wife and I wait a few more minutes for ours.  Most of her meal comes (no bread which was needed for the eggs), and my pancakes were no where to be found.  The remainder of our food finally comes to our table.  Bottom line service was awful.  Food was ok.  I will not rush back and will go out of my way to get to Pamela's for breakfast!

kHgT9bYgQsxeDIPvNmabTQ.text: Great space with fun decor friendly staff and  interesting menu.  Will return next time I'm in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

ylRtZdWn_T9qT2_pRrRUJQ.text: Great service and fantastic service. Stopped in on a Sunday and the place was very busy. Waited on right away and food arrived very fast. Stop in and have a great time!

4OsqIAPj4LEDQxLYaenRpw.text: Deluca's is becoming a regular haunt for us.  Why? you ask.  Well because the food is amazing!!! Huge sevings.  Friendly service.  My only pet peeve, and the reason for 4 stars, is I have yet to have an entire order come to the table at the same time.  It's always staggered and someone (whether a party of 2 or 5) has to wait for their food.  But the food is so worth the wait!!!!

_68GEWE3dhXEyhVH5KeWqQ.text: Stopped in this morning waiting for Ikea to open. There was a very short wait and we were seated very quickly.  I had the seafood omelet with egg white, home fries and wheat toast. The omelet was packed full with seafood and topped with fresh slices of avocado. Very tasty.  I would definitely return to this location.

k4zXBf18_0LG8fP0kAPgeA.text: Great service, great food. Perfect diner for those who want to take them time with breakfast.

8aFZHlf67oQn8i_7Gg6Xug.text: This was my first visit.  Very impressive menu.  I tried the Swedish pancakes with Lingenberry.  I could not eat more than half because the fake whipped cream was icky sweet and the lingenberries weren't so great either.  The crepe was OK, but I couldn't eat it with all that junk on it.  Original Pancake house on Greentree road has an excellent Swedish pancake with lingenberry.  DeLuca's came no where near it.  I expected to be offered something else, but I was not offered anything.  My friend shared his butter milk pancake which was not bad.   I don't plan to return.

h7-Mo8UyLkFYTl9U-88lJw.text: cold eggs and burnt French toast. we were not impressed by the food. we will not be going here again.

TiG5ULbSpGD75nfoCy7uoQ.text: We're in the Pittsburgh area visiting from out of town and spotted this place in a sea of chain restaurants and decided to give it a go. Despite our high hopes, the food really fell flat. We were in for lunch and none of us left pleased with our meal, but I will say their breakfast menu looked great - maybe we should have ordered that.

N3cI6G8grrybI-GEDNwyHA.text: This place really should be a 5, but since its in Pittsburgh its a 4. Not bad, just not the best in the area in my opinion. There are some good home cooked meals, but man Pittsburgh has some GREAT home cooked meals, and DeLucas doesn't quite fall under that. Not that is bad, just that its ok, and not quite a 5. I will come back here depending on my mod and what I want, but I cant say that  its my favorite or my go to. Definitely a good homecooked meal, but its just good. I do say that the atmosphere is very cool though. Very "Pittsburghish". Enjoy all ya Yinzers.

A0WGm4lS7ji0UoXDZUt62w.text: Place is a typical diner setting. Very friendly staff! (Thanks Mary)! Food was okay. Not the best ham I've tasted. Potatoes were a little burnt and eggs were over medium/hard.

AdihpkGIcQ_9G1fIHqKXlA.text: Weeks ago, something deep in my subconscious told me to stop in this new DeLuca's restaurant to end an unfinished grudge while returning home from a doctor's appointment.   As icy gales of illwill  ripped across Western Pennsylvania, The Adversary contemplated his next, ultimate assault, conferring with MOAB, The Mutha of All Burritos while reflecting on past encounters at two Burgatory satellites and the original Strip District DeLuca's. . .  "In this new Robinson locale, I shall crush Proletarian Steel forever more! What say you, burrito?" The Adversary asked his hulking, simple-minded, single-minded champion.  "MOAB izzz constipation. MOAB izzz indigestion. MOAB izzz heartburn. MOAB izzz doooooommmm!!!" The creature of chorizo, eggs, hot peppers, tomatoes, onions, avocado, cheddar, and homefries uttered, sounding like a trash compactor. A chile sauce of DeLuca's own making that was both saccharine and piquant bled a Satanic crimson all over MOAB's doughy, pale body as the Adversary cackled into the killing frost. Gazing into his magic mirror, The Adversary could see Kay and I en route to Pittsburgh from a doctor's visit in Chippewa.   "They're coming," The Adversary, clad in a coal-black suit, tie, and fedora, mentioned to MOAB.   "This Darren fellow, he barely lasted against the titanic tandem of Captain Drew's Seafood Omelet and the Funky Monkey Pancake stack. MOAB, you may be enough to finish him."  As Kay and I entered the 50's sci-fi themed diner, taking in the galactic, Atomic Age murals that adorned the interiors along with the silver and red motif of the furniture.   The Adversary appeared without warning amidst a cloud of inky smoke.   "This shall be our final meeting, our last duel, a dance...to the death!!!"  Kay was immediately subdued by hooded figures.   "Your love shall watch you perish," the funereal man warned. "Ah, the rings of Saturn...they are so appropriate. This will be my hour of cosmic evil! Attack, my minion!!!"   MOAB charged. Howling and snorting like a gigantic prehistoric boar, it knocked me to the cruel floor. Patrons gasped, fleeing in panic!   Once I regathered my strength and wits, I both blinded and suffocated the behemoth with packets of sour cream, taming its heat. When it hunched over, I leapt upon MOAB's back with gleaming utensils and plunged them into the beast's body as a matador would a bull. Proteins, starches, vegetables, dairy products, and grains would fly about the eatery turned gladiatorial arena. Within 15 minutes, MOAB was gone, and I belched in victory.   "What else ya got, Scratch?" I asked.   Stammering, the Adverary replied. "An insurance policy..."  The Funky Monkey Sundae arose from a trap door.   "Ha. Its big brother, the pancake stack, musta chickened out considering I pretty much whupped him." I said with a confident air.   Cursing, The Adversary, ordered the sundae to charge me with the point of a clawed finger. A carnal chimera of chocolate ice cream, bananas, whipped cream, peanut butter, and caramel slithered forward to meet its destiny. Ice cream headaches nothwithstanding, the glass dish would be emptied, and the salty, sugary, creamy dessert would be overcome.   Steam shooting from his nostrils, The Adversary telekinetically hurled planets at me with waves of his ghastly, skeletal hands. While I dodged the large constructs that had been thrown my way, Kay would use judo to toss both hooded henchmen into the Slim Onyx Count, ruining his concentration. An uppercut and a right cross would dispatch The Adversary's flunkies while a spinning backfist would put the magical mastermind onto his back.   "This had not ended!!!" the Adversary screamed in a rage with a nose bleeding tar.  "I've got an insurance policy of my own," I told my fiendish foe.   "No! NOOO!!!""  From out of my back pocket I pulled a small seltzer bottle full of Sprite that had been blessed by a priest and sprayed its full contents directly onto The Adversary's accursed face.   Soon, there was nothing left of him but an empty hat. His pair of lackeys would simply melt into pools of infernal, tacky goo.   "Whaddya think, Baby Doll?" I asked Kay as I placed the fedora onto my bald head.  "You rock that well, Sexyman. What a trophy!" Kay answered.  "Nah, YOU'RE my trophy, " I said as I pulled Kay towards me and kissed her.   The gray skies gave way to sun. Birds chirped. The winds died. The air warmed. Customers cheered.  A choir sang.                                     THE END  P.S. The food and service were exemplary on all fronts. Don't be a palooka. Hit up DeLucas!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. interiors
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Funky Monkey Sundae
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Inside the MOAB

1wlaRfxW4d6EDldI6sbbgw.text: A much-needed non-chain restaurant in Robinson township?!?!! They are too few and far between. While my heart lies with the original in the strip, my taste buds don't discriminate. The same awesome food is found here. One of these days, I will tear myself away from the omelets and mixed grill to try some of non-breakfast items that look fantastic coming out of the grill area. It's so nice to have a non-chain option in this area!!!  BONUS POINTS...my waitress offered me coffee to go! Great service AND food

0r6tc0_iyVeQftY-VT3G6Q.text: Walked in here with my boyfriend and left after 2 Minutes. We were originally seated in the back by the kitchen, and then when I kindly asked if we could sit at another table, our waitress literally threw our menus on the table and walked away. Nobody came to get our drinks and it smelled like B.O. Never returning here again.

l9mxkSdkWjkVlMsFClnVeA.text: The food is amazing! Take your time to read the menu. SO many crazy choices. The portions are huge. Man vs. Food plays on a constant loop on some of the TVs. It's clean. Colorful. Fast service. The Superbowl is a creative omelet filled with keilbasa, onions, tomatoes, mashed potatoes and is served with a side of sauerkraut and hot apples. Wow! We will definitely be back. My only complaints were the wobbly tables (we moved twice) and the freezing cold breeze from an open door in the kitchen.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The Superbowl!
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

MTRRA9KvYssR9U3abK2z7A.text: I enjoyed a late breakfast solo dolo today. Even though there are still 100+ things I could've tried, I decided on my usual.. the Steel City Breakfast of Champs. It comes with 2 eggs any style, bacon AND sausage, home fries, toast + two pancakes (can't believe you get so much food for about $10)   I'm personally happy about the new restaurant in Robinson. Besides downtown where I work and Oakland where I live, Robinson is where I spend alot of my time. Mostly bc Bobby works out there and I head out that way to get away from my usual work and home routine..   But anyways, this location accepts cards unlike the strip district location. breakfast is all day.  If you've never been to Delucas, the menu is so large! So many options from breakfast platters to omelets, French toast, pancakes, crepes and sundae style pancakes.. SO. MANY. OPTIONS for each category... And this is just breakfast.  My breakfast was delish. The only thing is I could've sworn at the strip district I had the choice of pancakes or French toast. I definitely ordered French toast last time and remember there being a decision lol. For the combos like mine, you can upgrade to fancy pancakes or fancy French toast for $1-$2 extra. If I must add, the home fries today were extremely well done. Alot of the home fries were burnt, extra hard pieces of potato that could've seriously chipped a tooth if you want a proper description. That's not going to stop me from coming though bc everything else was great :)

6abKUatH1wb7oELt1ORGNw.text: I went to this place for the first time today by myself while Christmas shopping because it looked nice and nostalgic inside with the 50s diner look. Long story short while sitting at the counter for quick service, or so I thought,  the waitress who wasnt around was told by the cashier that I was waiting to order, mean while she just continued to joke around and laugh with the cook while I'm sitting there waiting to order. I finally got fed up waiting and just left. So I cannot comment on the food because I never got a chance to try it but I can comment that the service was terrible !!

Hd-jBg4cP09pZ11tjaQzkQ.text: Stop by and try Deluca's #2. Yes, Deluca's has opened a new diner in Robinson. Nice new clean space. The same delicious food. We got there just before you had to wait and the place is pretty large, so it is popular. The mixed grill was delicious..selected the hot sausage, over easy egg and the Mancini's bread that comes with is Oh So Good! The have a Halloween special on pumpkin pancakes. Our waitress was on the ball, always there for a refill when needed. facebook page: facebook.com/pages/Deluc...

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

hHg157-qBM1kt9hp-YRqxA.text: I like DeLuca's diner. They have a nice selection of food that ranges from breakfast to dinner type food. It's exactly what you'd expect for diner food and the service is pretty great as well.

GNfm-FNbooJq4SNbPGFvtQ.text: Breakfast was fantastic! I had a create your own omelette!! I was so fool from breakfast, I didn't have to eat lunch!!

HRvyrKmaDg_0NeD5G_Io7Q.text: Awesome food. Awesome service.  Just had the Country Fried Chicken & Eggs. Very good!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

plgShaJUH6T8i8yic7v5TQ.text: Found this on yelp and it was worth the visit.  Super fast friendly service.  The food is fantastic!   I had the eggs Benedict and the hollandaise was perfect .  Hubby had the corned beef hash and was equally happy with his meal. Highly recommend for breakfast!

1XuO2WnknNCr-7c50bsZ1g.text: Always great service and amazing food. It's nice they take cards here. Sitting at the counter is always the easiest and quickest way to get a seat on a busy weekend morning

hKKtT_MgLfzF97-fVpaK8A.text: They're very busy, even in the Robinson location, but they have a large, efficient staff that is good at moving people through; you shouldn't have to wait too long.    The menu is huge and busy, you might consider reading it online before you go,  and though their other food looked good, too, DeLuca's is famous for their breakfasts.  My girlfriend ate the short stack pancakes with a side of bacon, and left plenty for me to finish.  I had the Moab burrito.  My burrito was good, I asked for extra Spanish sauce, but the avocados were so far from ripe that the restaurant should have declined to serve them; they were like hard pieces of cardboard.  I told my server and the checkout girl, but neither seemed overly concerned about the food quality.  That was my only complaint though, and I would return to the restaurant, but next time I'll order pancakes and eggs.

Fb_eQQd9VDY0UBkolIDXcA.text: Food is good. The place is very clean. However, customer service is lacking. I was trying to pay my bill and the lady told me it will be a second. She finished cashing out someone and then walked away and started getting people coffee etc. Very rude.

RVx68DbTWHcJBUlt8Ww-0w.text: This was a disappointment. We were driving by and saw that this place was pretty crowded. We go in and sit down and order our food, which took 45 minutes to come out. Strike one. Once the food finally came out, the sandwich I ordered was plain and tasteless and the fries tasted burnt. Strike two. My mother ordered French toast and it had foreign food all in it. Bacon, bits of eggs and home fries, and other unknowns bits of food. And the side order of home fries she ordered tasted burnt as well. Strike three. Then we go in the bathroom and there is no soap and it had an awful smell. It looked like it hasn't been cleaned in months. Do not even waste your money here.

qlfWa1IBpRipJ9TmvP66HA.text: Eaten there several times. Always excellent service and food. Clean bathrooms.  Priced right, more food than I can eat.

nSAGtM3yxe_PTPeszSEBew.text: We stopped here before heading to Pittsburgh International Airport. I had a veggie wrap with chipotle pesto. It was really good.  Also, I approached the waitress with a special request and even though she mentioned that they usually do not do special things she was able to surprise us all with something special for my fiance's birthday.  All the staff we saw here was very friendly and helpful. The prices were relatively fair and food was delicious. I will make sure to stop at some of their other locations when I go back to Pittsburgh.

sNVbtLyAScNaCQ-boMoOmw.text: Worth the twenty minute wait for breakfast.  Huge menu, and many alternatives for breakfast meat and bread choices.  Good Greek omelet served with hash browns and sourdough bread.  Our friend's seafood omelet looked amazing.  Definitely a popular, affordable place.

bRZgi3VahI5KKuLpZvJtjQ.text: Great food, quick service, large portions for breakfast. I certainly understand why it is so popular.

bSLiVvGiybWdUMTyLOjf8w.text: Califonia Benedict was probably the best breakfast I've ever had.  They place is clean and the service is good. My coffee was never empty.

YowjdoUx1I-jVmxjg0dUZQ.text: Don't get the waffles. It was the worst thing I've ever eaten. They were doughy and tasted like bananas, but in a bad way. Do not waste your money on such an appalling excuse for waffles.

g-DqKE38Afo5y-O9W-NddQ.text: I frequently stop at DeLuca's for breakfast. This visit, I opted to try a lunch item. I was not disappointed!! I ordered this club sandwich- the bread was thick and there was plenty of turkey and bacon. F you're going during breakfast hours, especially on the weekend, be prepared to wait. The wait is definitely worth it. I highly recommend the Steel City Breakfast of Champs

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

g07JRZyIe5utz7_QTRi54w.text: Last year began the tradition of going to DeLuca's every time my family visits from Minneapolis. The hotel we stay at (Homewood Suites) recommended it and they offer a free shuttle to and from it.   The service is always welcoming and friendly. Our server, Nicole, was super sweet, personable and attentive.   Last year I had an amazing omelet that spanned the edges of the plate. This time I had an egg and cheese sandwich on Mancini's Italian bread (the BEST bread in the world!) with their crispy home fries. My sister had pancakes that were bigger than her hand. They were perfectly  fluffy and slightly crispy on the edges.   Best of all, the prices are very reasonable and all proceeds of any DeLuca's gift purchase (coffee mug, shirt, etc.) goes to non-profit animal rescues! (The menu includes a very important reminder to spay or neuter your pets : )

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Eggceptional sandwich ($4.99) &amp; home fries ($2.99)
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The Hotcake Special: Two HUGE buttermilk pancakes with choice of eggs and meat $8.59
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Make-your-own-omelet with home fries

MEznsQAR3xqx7p_-XU_kbg.text: Very good breakfast food. If you like breakfast, Deluca's does a great job. I've never had lunch there, but I'm sure they do that well, too.

eQ15a_N6bTBnD2pdtc7R7A.text: Passed through Pittsburg today, I really wanted to go to the original in the strip district, however, traveling with a 4 year old and new born, and with the parking issues in the strip district we opted for their other location near the mall in park manor.  My son and, I split the banana praline pancakes topped with ice cream and whip cream.  First of all the pancakes by themselves tasted like a doughnut or a cake.  Than you add the pralines and bananas along with some kind of rum, and you get a masterpiece.  The pancakes reminded a little bit of a banana foster.  We ordered a side of eggs and bacon and both were a cut above the rest, not your typical bacon and eggs.  My wife and mother and law ordered the seafood paradise crepe, and the seafood omelette.  Both came with a cheesy hollandaise that was absolutely delicious.  Both came with langostino's, shrimp, and lump crab meat.  Everyone absolutely loved their meal.  Would absolutely come back here if, I lived here and, I cannot say that about too many breakfast places.

OMGN7Nypf_Jg_mXug5wevQ.text: I grew up going to the Strip location so I was anxious to try this place out in my neighborhood! We went on Sunday morning and only had to wait about 20 minutes.   The decor was cute and the inside was much bigger than I expected for being in a strip mall! The food was delicious, just as I would get in the Strip! I had Nutella French toast and my husband had a huge omelet which he was able to take half home! The kids menu was perfect for my son. This is a great family friendly restaurant! We'll definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

wthhsTJhbc6dcdktnojhLg.text: Took a quick trip to Pittsburgh with the wife and kids, before we went to Pittsburgh we planned on stopping at a popular restaurant or diner. We went online to see if any food Network shows had been to the area. It just happens that Delucas had been featured on man VS food. We stopped in to check it out. It's a very family friendly place. The hostess and waitresses were older, which was very welcoming. The interior definitely has an older look to it which is refreshing. And the kitchen is open to watch.  But about the food, we ordered our sons cheeseburger sliders and their chicken fingers. Now these chicken fingers were HUGE. Full hand breaded cutlets and they were pretty tasty. My wife also ordered a chicken finger basket. But for me I still desired breakfast so I ordered the M.O.A.B. (Mother of all burritos) my goodness this thing was mammoth. Chorizo, eggs, potatoes, cheese and more cheese with banana peppers stuffed in a flour tortilla. I gotta say it was pretty good, I didn't finish it, and with good reason. This thing is huge. But the potatoes inside were amazing. The eggs were fluffy and my goodness the chorizo. If anyone is ever in the Pittsburgh area, please stop here. You won't regret it.

1lB_IgBSmCePtPXFCHi9BA.text: My first time trying DeLuca's and the breakfast I had was fresh and very satisfying.  My Denver omelette, while not inexpensive, was huge and filled with what seemed like premium ingredients compared to usual diner fare.  If you are very hungry for breakfast this is a pretty good stop off!

NP-4j9lX6iBRNwB6KPFH6w.text: Great eggs, hot sausage and potatoes were delicious. Lots of omelette choices. I love that they carry tomato juice. Server was really nice.

TGYY02oMhZ_gl1k4kxcfLw.text: Excellent food.  The French toast taste delicious and the chicken and waffles are pretty good too, not Roscoe's House of Chicken and Waffles, Maggianos, or Chicago's Home of Chicken and Waffles but for Pittsburgh they are probably at or near the top.  The pancake was good as the bacon eggs and potatoes.  They give you a sausage patty the size of a burger but all in all it was good.  The presentation leaves much to be desired so I can't give it 5 stars but the food is fantastic!

e_DEnl6pCYLPQP-kBHE07Q.text: People love this place, and for good reason. The food is good and there is a lot of it. My boyfriend thought everything was really good (he got the Steel City Breakfast of champs, which is a little bit of everything, and I got the MOAB burrrito). I thought that the burrito was perfectly "ok" and I would not order it again. All I could taste was tomato paste and a hint of taco seasoning. But it's just a matter of preference, I suppose. I will definitely be back and trying something different. I'll follow up on this review then.

iIRCbxeiaOObwc6nmTgQTw.text: This place is gross and needs to be visited by the health department.  I spent the whole meal killing fruit flies that were flying everywhere throughout the restaurant and into my food. This would be fine if the weather wasn't 4 degrees outside,  GROSS

3NGoOmPJHFXuWQttg83Lng.text: We were in the area and found this quaint diner. It's not that far from the airport and the menu offers breakfast food and lunches. Our party ordered a hot turkey sandwich, eggs Benedict with ham, and MOAB which is a breakfast burrito. Being from Texas we thought things were big but the servings here were BIG!!!  Our food was delicious and our server,Barry, was friendly and helpful. Our coffee cups were kept full and food was fresh and hot!  If you're in town we suggest you have at least one meal here!

7hSVQFGm3hQ7xbgEC248xg.text: Came here for breakfast and it did not disappoint. Had to wait about 20 minutes for a table on a Sunday morning. The food portions were generous. I had a Nutella/banana crepe, which had a full banana stuffed inside it. Everything I saw come out to nearby tables looked delicious. Reasonable prices and friendly service.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Nutella banana crepe

EqvlnM-5w8igpXT-5GCmPw.text: I've been here 3-4 times since it opened. I usually enjoy eating here more than the original in the Strip District. There's typically not a huge line or long wait at this location. Worth it to avoid touristy-nonsense and try the exact same food. They have always got me right in and right out. Food never disappoints!   The Californian omelette is amazing! It's one of my favorites... with Chipotle Pesto Chicken, Asiago Cheese, Tomatoes, Avocado, Roasted Red Peppers & Spinach. Delicious. I highly recommend it.

hpqq70wHAejDomNW_ibBwQ.text: Love this place! It's not the original in the strip but really isn't a whole lot different.  We got here at 9:00 and I thought it would be packed. It was busy but they had open tables. We walked in, got seated and ordered all under 3 minutes, unreal! Im so used to standing in line for 40 minutes at the one in the strip.   My wife had the pumpkin pancakes (gross!) She said they were good and didn't overpower you with pumpkin flavor. I had corned beef hash, eggs, toast, and home fries. As usual everything was delicious.   The food was out quick and the service was fast and friendly. What more could you want? Anytime we are in the Robinson area and it's breakfast time Delucas is the first choice.

T12JRR1RRn7Ple6uzSixCw.text: I have eaten at DeLuca's in the Strip District so I was anxious to try this location. I was meeting a friend for lunch. When I saw that they had Biscuits and Gravy on the menu I was totally psyched!!  When they arrived at the table the wind blew out of my sails. The "sausage" was pink. YUCK! It was room temperature. One of biscuits was hard as a rock.  I was completely disappointed.  My friend ordered fried chicken tenders and fries. Her looked delicious and she enjoyed it.    Since it's Deluca's I will give them a second chance but I will definitely order something different.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken Tenders and Fries
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Biscuits and Gravy

fPKACkMhOAWwDP_A-rhVXQ.text: I came to this location in the hopes that it would be as good as the strip district location, but it wasn't. As a kid I can remember going to the strip and having breakfast at DeLucas, and getting the most amazing chocolate chip pancakes with a tower of whipped cream and it being the best thing ever! The chocolate chip cakes I had to say were pretty good, but not the same. Service was ok, nothing great. Our food came out super fast and the portions were HUGE. My son and I could have easily split the hot cake special I ordered. The food itself was fairly plain. I want a fan of the eggs or the sausage. The pancakes were good though. Everything was fairly priced in my opinion. Coffe, my breakfast and my sons breakfast with 2 substitutions was less then $20. The staff didn't seem like they really enjoyed their job very much. I understand diner mentality, and you wanna turn and burn tables quickly, but there were less then 10 tables and only 2 at the counter. A smile wouldn't hurt anyone. The one thing I was a little taken aback by was that when I was checking out, I used my checking card and when I was asked to enter a pin, I didn't want to, so I asked the girl checking me out which button to press so that I could sign for my purchase and she not only did she not know she was a little rude about whatever comes up is what you have to do. I will most likely not return for breakfast or any other meal at this location

52OMgzEKCc3QUqqprmtocA.text: I'm a big fan of DeLuca's in the strip, so when I'm out and about in the Robinson area I'm excited about stopping here for the familiar food with a considerably shorter wait.  The space is tight, especially for a new-ish mom with purse, diaper bag and flailing toddler in tow. This was much easier to navigate back when it was just me. That being said, once you squeeze your way through the tables there are high chairs and the space is kid friendly (as are the servers, they loved chatting with my son!).  The menu appears to be the same as the strip location with sweet and savory offerings - so I went with my go to order, the mixed grill with sweet Italian sausage. Here's where one star gets knocked off my review - there were hardly any potatoes in the mixed grill, and the sausage is usually chopped up and mixed in...not this time. Just a lump sitting atop the pile of peppers.  Will I order it again? Absolutely. It's my favorite savory breakfast dish - but I'm really hoping they fix the potato to pepper ratio before then.   That being said, you can't go wrong with other traditional breakfast fare - especially the pancakes! If given the choice, I would pick the strip district location over this once...long lines and all. Even though they are slammed with business they have never disappointed.

OwjzF4V2tk3oYeWyvYA9qg.text: Go to place for breakfast if in the Pittsburgh area.  Food is homemade and big portions.  Had to take home our food because it was too much to eat at once.  Service was excellent as well!

tf5a67sN1yG5Hh7mneeh7w.text: This place is american %100  Huge portion  lot of people and good atmosphere Always when I  around Always stop py

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

3zXASmI-pqECSUQqnv-VdQ.text: Been wanting to try this place for years, since i saw the Man vs. Food episode anyway. Finally made it here early for breakfast on a Saturday and the place was filling up fast. However, we received incredibly fast and efficient service! The portions are large and the menu offers a great variety. If i lived closer, DeLuca's would be my regular breakfast spot!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Swedish Blintz Crêpe

6-J3QYvXAeX3_iMVloy82Q.text: So before visiting Pittsburgh, I asked friends from the area where I needed to go for food. And DeLuca's Diner on the Strip was recommended. Naturally since Sunday was nicer out than on Saturday, that area was not favorable for parking. So we saw that a second location was open about 20+minutes out. Sweet, so we made our was to this location under the thought that we'd have no problems. I wish I had a crystal ball, hell I would've settled for a magic 8 ball.   We go inside and there are two other couples waiting. Cool no problem. The wait was barely five minutes. Get seated in a booth. Great! Look over the menu. Order a Large orange juice. The server comes back we place our order. I order the California Benedict, and then the other order was the Omelette Special. Alright, Simple enough!  Then I start observing. The booth next to us, a party of five, seemed to get there orders, but not at the same time, and the timing between their orders being delivered was staggered at best. This seemed troubling, but I kept observing. At one point one of the bidders was sweeping near us and made some loud comment about how he "needed to get paid." Um awkward. Oh look another plate came for the party of five, still three more to go. Needless to say it took awhile for them to get their orders. This continued to be unsettling. Then I overhear the booth behind me, their server apologized, and told them that she'd give them a discount for the inconvenient wait time. Wow, that's cool. The whole time we waited, we never once were visited by our server, given an update on the order. No offer of coffee. Almost 45min goes by and we get our food. 45 minutes, and it was close to closing time.   Food arrives. And presentation was .......lacking at best. My home fries looked different from those on the other plate. My overall plate just wasn't great. The omelette was burnt. Like making an omelette should be apart of Breakfast 101. Cooking multiple orders shouldn't be rocket science, contrary to the outer space mural on the wall.   When it came time to pay. We asked if we could leave the tip with the cashier. She said to just leave it on the table, well the table was already being bussed, and after the busser made that comment, we weren't exactly jumping to drop it on the table.   Maybe it's a locals favorite, maybe the original spot is better. But I wouldn't waste the time going here again if I'm back in Pittsburgh. Service is key, even if thevwait is horrendous.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. California Benedict

V2OnZA4G2xlW8yP_al7cdQ.text: My friend took me here, after months of us meaning to try it.   The location is in a plaza (near IKEA), but the old timey diner makes you feel like you've stepped back into time. The dining furniture was worn, but clean. Very vintage.  The waitress was annoyed we didn't know what we wanted to eat within 2 minutes. She gave us coffee and warm cream, but never asked if we wanted a refill. Our food came our fast and the order was accurate. My eggs were very oily/buttery so I only ate one yolk (over easy), it was cold. My pancakes looked great, but were flavorless. It was the first time I thought "did I just order lumpy, mushy flour for food?". I ate most of the topping, but was underwhelmed. My friend enjoyed her meal, so I pretended that I had eaten earlier. The waitress didn't ask how my food was, so I didn't say anything.   Afterward, I grabbed something from Starbucks since I was still hungry.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Strawberry banana pancakes

N_KWtcAwUmiByvUGvCQ8Uw.text: My husband and I came here during Christmas week, maybe on New Year's Eve morning?  It was a mess of people.  Very busy.  But, that's OK - we are happy to wait.  We waited about 20 minutes to be seated (you can let them know that you are OK with a table or at the counter.  Sometimes the counter seats faster).    We got coffee, and I got the Swedish crepes and a side of corned beef hash.  The crepe was amazing - one of the best I've had.  The corned beef was fine.  I'm not sure how to explain it... it was small diced potatoes and corned beef, not the bigger german style potatoes and corned beef that I usually end up with.  It was not a dry hash.  I can't remember what my husband had, because I was too busy enjoying my own food.  We will be back when we have errands to run in Robinson in the morning hours.  It was overall worth the wait.

PwWKrqn12NxD6ndsHi7u4w.text: Anyone who has been to Robinson, knows there's nothing but chain restaurants. DeLuca's Diner is the exception. I'm so mad at myself for waiting so long to finally try it. Went on a Saturday afternoon and the place was packed, so I knew it was a good sign. The sandwiches are the size of your head! Everything is homemade, down to the gravy. I will absolutely be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Homemade chicken noodle soup
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Hot turkey sandwich on Mancini&#39;s bread

6kgbKmvxyHyWmd4srMnATw.text: This is such an amazing breakfast place in the morning! Very busy though so make sure you get there EXTRA early. Amazing food and not badly priced at all! Very small but such a great place with loving staff and you can enjoy it with your family

Ad0nTmBE5LFCIMHHCq8Owg.text: Came here while traveling for business with co-workers for breakfast.  It definitely has the diner feel and is located in a strip mall.  I wasn't sure what to expect given some of the reviews but I was pleasantly surprised so I'm happy I made my own opinion.  Service was good and prices were even better.  I got the seafood Benedict and loved it.  The hollandaise sauce was delicious. Portion sizes were huge!  Menu has pretty much anything you may want for breakfast so can't go wrong!

02lnzSVFtsthiNF7wGsZiQ.text: Love this greasy-spoon spot in its original instantiation down in the strip, and I love it out in Robinson. Friendly service, short-order food (we had four of us, including two kids, out). They didn't charge extra for hot chocolate refills, and that's a winner in my book. I ate fried eggs, sausage, pancakes, and had coffee, and I loved it all - but diner food is sorta my thing. I love it as long as it ain't bad, and this was good.  There was a mistake on one of the ordered meals, and the server took the plate away (for good) saying she'd adjust the tab, but then she took off maybe $2 rather than the cost of the meal we didn't eat or take with us. I wasn't the one paying the bill, and this fact was confusing to the point at which I didn't understand that's what she did until it wasn't worth going back to address. (If you take someone's mostly-full plate without offering a replacement, you gotta take that whole order off the tab...).  Apart from that oddity and some wet silverware, the meal was priced reasonably and the food was good - I'd surely go back.

8OfN-ZVXgK-Aub4rjJ9tiQ.text: This breakfast was everything I expected from a diner and more! I had a traditional breakfast of eggs, sausage and home fries. Everything was great and the service was too! My server was constantly topping off my coffee and keeping it hot!

KWsScKQ2aMyYR_6yfVKHgQ.text: I have been the the Strip District location several times in the past and always left satisfied, so I figured I would feel the same going to the Robinson location.   We walked in and asked if we would be able to sit at the empty counter. Our server came over within a minute and we ordered coffee. The menu is quite extensive, so we asked for a few minutes to figure out what to order for our breakfasts. My husband got waffles, eggs and bacon. I opted for the banana prailenes & cream crepes with a side of scrambled eggs. It wasn't busy, so everything came out rather quickly.   My food was really tasty and worth the $9 for the crepe. I was only able to finish half of it. My husband's meal was big in comparison to other places, but he wasn't full and said it definitely wasn't his favorite breakfast.   The server was nice, but she wasn't very attentive once we got our food. Her and another server sat at the end of the counter and shot the breeze most of the time. I understand it was slow for them due to the cold weather, but I feel they should have been cleaning something or found something productive to do. That's IMO though....   Food was good overall, but it is really pricey, especially for breakfast. Give it a try if you want, but know there are other cheaper places if you're on a budget.

LEUzhh1-jTxx-8vL1zkU9w.text: Breakfast is always great here!!! Today an omelette with provolone,  kielbasa,  hot sausage. And onions!!! Sided with some fried potatoes and fresh Mancinis bread, a Pittsburgh staple for sure!!!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

TG68ESCScDaayQGMgRjzAw.text: Probably my favorite diner. I will admit that I have never been to the original location in The Strip District, but I imagine the menus are pretty much the same.  Huge Omelettes! Great Lobster Bisque and sandwiches. This place is good for Breakfast or Lunch.  Be prepared to wait, as this is a popular place on the weekends for Breakfast.  There are too many things that I have had and liked here to list them all, but you can't go wrong with an Omelette or Pancakes for Breakfast. They have some Pancake and Waffle dishes that are covered in Whipped Cream and Syrup, they might as well be deserts. Good lunch options are the Burgers or various sandwiches. I enjoy the Club myself with a bowl of the Bisque and a side of Onion Rings.  Something for everyone, you will not be disappointed!

qpyb-zP8-SjDTXLExnnKNA.text: Two stars might be generous. We came to DeLucas to get some of the lobster bisque that I love. Alas- this is only a weekend option. Fine. My husband ordered a coffee, a sandwich, and a side of breakfast ham. He had to ask for the coffee 3x before it finally got there and the ham twice.  I ordered the fish sandwich with onion rings. Sandwich comes and it's dry and over cooked with four pieces of cold cheese plopped on top. The onion rings came about 5 minutes later and they were squishy and under cooked. SUPER disappointing, and the worst part is the server has this cocky, careless attitude the whole time. If you get this server, you will know what I'm talking about. I found myself becoming envious of another table that had a friendly and animated waitress. We were never asked how the food was by our server, the manager who was milling about, or the lady who took our payment. I decided that if I WAS asked, I would have been honest and posted a favorable review if it was addressed. It was not. You got it wrong, DeLucas. And while people wait for a LONG time for a table here- it wasn't even busy today. And they also seem to forget they have an open kitchen. So when we ask about the missing items and you say "they're on their way" but turn around and ask the staff to make them quickly, we hear you. Two stars because I'll probably be back for the bisque- but for takeout ONLY!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Burnt fish with cold cheese. You can&#39;t do this in a town that prides itself with its bomb fish sammies.
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Old school diner set up with &#34;Universal&#34; flare. You&#39;ll see what I mean.

e-0tLDkQhlV2xY-GxWGZtA.text: Deluca's Diner had amazing food and service to match! I was with a group of 5 people, fresh off the plane from San Francisco, CA and we were hungry for some of Pittsburgh's finest food. Our breakfast was amazing and we were impressed with Pittsburgh's hospitality! Thank you, DeLuca's, see you soon!

j_qoldsxr9D54F1RoRxStg.text: Hubby loved Deluca's. Excellent customer service. Great food at reasonable prices.  We originally wanted to visit the historical Deluca's in The Strip district, but once we learned that there was one right around the corner from our hotel, we opted to avoid the crowds and parking situation. This Deluca's is very convenient for those staying in the same area. It's located in a suburbanite strip mall.   The food portions were good. The prices were reasonable and breakfast tasted great. Our waitress was very attentive and helpful. I, too, thoroughly enjoyed this local gem and will certainly be returning again.

kFVWsd_tARCQ53ZTkL1GWA.text: We chose to do breakfast at DeLuca's because their website intrigued us.  Their decor was outer space themed and their menu was huge. Upon arrival we were greeted by friendly staff and were seated immediately. We all had a hard time deciding what to order because their menu was so large. I ordered the breakfast burrito and per my usual requested that certain items be omitted. This was the only time in my life I will admit that I shouldn't have done that!  I was envious as I saw everyone else's burrito come out because mine was plain and boring. Overall, my party agreed the food was good but nothing to write home about. The portions are enormous though so prepare yourself. When we left, the line waiting for a table was quite long. DeLuca's was a good, quick breakfast but not somewhere I'd go regularly.

DxfPA_fRAg2Jw6NAu6NdvQ.text: Owner is rude treats his staff horribly and only cares about making money. Food was adequate. I could've had same quality at a chain breakfast diner.

eyvQwQr4ww4gED3NqaGYXw.text: Met a couple old friends here today...a bit of a jaunt for us all, but kinda midway between all our homes. First time for me at this restaurant (diner?). One of the fellows recommended it, and I'm sure glad he did! In a nutshell - clean, friendly and efficient waitstaff that kept up with everything. Good coffee. Terrific greek omelett (my choice) and the other dishes delivered look good and were wolfed down as was mine. Very reasonably priced. I'll be stopping by again next time I'm in the area. Terrific eats!

PytzHUltc-t_4Xr6zgQAxw.text: Recently I was in the greater in the Pittsburgh area, and I wanted to try a new diner. A quick google search found the DeLuca's Diner.  DeLuca's Diner is located in a large shopping center. The inside is brightly painted with the solar system. There are plenty of booths, tables, and a small bar as well.  It is stereotypical of a diner.   Coffee:  The coffee was brewed hot and fresh, and the waitress refilled it often. In all, I have no complaints.  While the mugs given were not personalized, they have many options for sale.   I ended up purchasing a personalized coffee mug (which the proceeds go to a local animal shelter!).  How awesome is that?   Food:  There are plenty of options from all day breakfast and lunch. All day lunch isn't something you find everywhere! From the tables around me, everything looked delicious.   I decided to order a breakfast sandwich. It came with meat, cheese, and an egg, all on a homemade piece of bread. It was a great sandwich, and I have no complaints.   Service:  The waitress was friendly, and our food came out quickly. I couldn't have asked for better service.  Overall Thoughts/Summary: I enjoyed DeLuca's Diner, and if I'm in Pittsburgh again, I will be back.  The pancakes at a table nearby looked amazing, and I want to try those next.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Breakfast sandwich (very good)

6y7VoU3Cm0_v1g0GpmVTVw.text: My hubby and I come here often for breakfast while running errands in the area. Weekends are always packed full of customers waiting for a table so I reccomens getting there early! The food is always delicious and I prefer to always get a crepe with different fillings. P_TtK04YUmZav_PQp_JNcg.text: I love Deluca's! Honestly, I prefer the authenticity of the strip location, but this one is just as quick and friendly. The only reason I'm giving 4 stars and not 5 is because my egg white omelette was a little runny for my taste. However, the chocolate chip banana pancakes, well... those were just incredible. And the coffee is always good too! I have to say, the prices aren't bad for all of the food that you get either. We had quite a bit of stuff and our bill was around $40. I'm not saying it's as cheap as somewhere like Denny's, but the quality isn't comparable either. In all honesty, I do think they try really hard here to make sure the customer is always happy and taken care of. The customer service is pretty much unbeatable. Overall, great experience! Wouldn't change anything except my own difficult order.

Es1iIo25PqVIx7ai7OYRgg.text: Stopped in on the way to work this morning. Staff is amazing. Abundant food. Getting the potatoes deep fried, WOW! Had the HBK omelette special. Delicious! Thanks Deluca's!!!

oatkwWCrI8M7LL9-DgD-GQ.text: I absolutely love DeLuca's. The staff is always so friendly and the food usually comes quickly! Their breakfast is to die for. The eggs Benedict are great. The pancakes are so fluffy and flavorful! And the sausage gravy and biscuits is really out of this world. This is my favorite breakfast spot in Robinson!!

B8J0dKuI1aH74GYx8jwNZw.text: Was hungry after shopping nearby and saw this diner. I decided to take a chance for lunch at 1pm.  Service was great.  Ordered the "South of the Border" omlet.  A day later and I'm still full.  It was so good I almost ate the dish.  2.79 for coffee was a bit steep, but I got free refills and I understand that it costs a lot to maintain a brick and mortar building.

Y3ZKpIbDAzulh05JtL-5Ag.text: Had a great breakfast here. Best ham, egg and cheese I've ever had and I've had a lot. Pancakes were delicious. Not sure what they put in them but they were amazing. Service was good. Extensive menu. Quality food. I'd eat breakfast here everyday if I could.

xft61kqk27DlnJh1WcGK_Q.text: We come here every Sunday after Cycle Bar. We love it! There home fries are nice and crisp cooked on the grill (not deep fried). They use Mancini's bread (try the raisin toast). I normally always get a custom made omelette, although they have a lot to choose from. My holiday favorite is the pumpkin pancake drizzled with cream cheese icing. The kitchen area is exposed so you will smell like good ole grease afterwards but well worth it. Also, in the weekends they get busy around 8:45.

95xFkbfCucKU3c_sorv-IA.text: Hands down one of my favorite crepes I've had. I just decided to stop while I was in the airport and I'm so glad I did. The staff is so friendly and the food is awesome. Highly recommend!
