eoIJ_VPEPFnI9L2TMRV_XQ.text: Why is this only a 3?  This place is a gem. You are greeted like family and the staff is fun to watch. The choices are fantabulous, the portions will require a nap afterwards. If you are hungry, they have 6 egg omelettes...4 egg is the NORM. Hand cut steaks.  Making my choice was the hardest time. Your coffee/water never empty.   Glad I tried this local venue. Home run

taYh116yoTt1l8ws_CktmA.text: More back-to-back reviews... but this is the dramatic conclusion to my Pittsburgh trip.   Before heading back to Virginia, we asked the front desk where would be a good restaurant to go for brunch (or lunch, didn't matter). At first the receptionist said First Watch, which we both knew well, considering there's a few locations in Northern Virginia, but when she suggested DeLuca's, only 5 minutes away from the hotel, it was fairly hard to pass up, especially since it is a Pittsburgh only establishment; a nice way to wrap up the weekend festivities.   When we pulled up to the restaurant, it was clear that this was a popular place, even on a Sunday. Throngs of people were coming and going, and we even had ourselves a 15 minute wait before anything got started. But once we got a table, things got interesting.  The menu has a plethora of everything you would expect for breakfast, brunch, and lunch (the joint closes at 3 pm). I was undecided between the pancakes, French toast, Eggs Benedict, and the Chicken and Waffles. My friend got pancakes and eggs. When it came to my order, I asked our server and she suggested the Chicken and Waffles (which is a PA staple). My meal also came with eggs, which I wanted over medium.  When the food arrived, it came in a lot of plates, and a lot of it on them. The pancakes were HUGE; my friend said they were fluffy and tasty. He liked his eggs. For my dish, the chicken was just okay, I was slightly disappointed, but the waffle was really good. Nice taste and a good complement to the chicken. My eggs were salty and buttery, and I felt it as soon as the meal ended. But I'm happy I got what I got. I can get French toast and pancakes anywhere. Chicken and Waffles are harder to find in Virginia (outside of the chain restaurants).   The bill was fairly reasonable too. Tell you what, overall, the cost for food in this area is really cheap and reasonable. I can see why people want to move here, the overall cost of living is just fantastic.   While the experience didn't blow me away (my friend like it), this meal concluded a Pittsburgh weekend I probably won't forget for a while.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Are those pancakes?!
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken and Waffles... with over medium egg.

TflPpQ7CgiJZy3u3sXqBPQ.text: Large delicious portions. I had the famous breakfast burrito with hot sausage and Housefries. So good! The portion of meat was insane. They get it from a local source, it's delicious! The house fries are an amazing crispy touch. They don't over load it with cheese to cover the flavor, just the perfect mix of egg to meat. Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

iZYCBwdcIq7pPfzq8O7uWw.text: I just can't say enough about the seafood omelet! They use real shrimp and crab...and there is a lot of it! Covered in a hollandaise sauce...I don't know how they can afford to use so much expensive ingredients! A couple of slices of avocado tops it off! Wow! It comes with home fries and toast. A really big meal that I would even eat for dinner if they were open. Alas, they are only open for breakfast and lunch so wake up and get moving! This place is great!  Update: we came back today with a guest. We all loved the food! But the service was spot on! I can't even say enough About our waiter, Thomas. The ketchup lid was not on tightly. Without checking, one of us shook the bottle only to get ketchup everywhere! Thomas helped clean up and brought back a really nice shirt to change into! That was the kindness act that I have witnessed in a while! Now that is service above and beyond! I will come back often sure! Thanks Thomas!

eDScszO4SsNpt8pQwP5Dgg.text: After stopping in Pittsburgh during a road trip, I was starving for some grub. I searched my trusty yelp app and discovered Deluca's. I remembered the name and place from an episode of Diners, Drive-Ins & Dives and jumped at the chance to try some food because Guy Fieri knows his ISH!  SO its in a strip mall, weird i know. Its kind of hidden, not a huge sign to say Delucas but nevertheless we got there.  Its a diner True and True. Red bar stools, black and white checkered floors, all the retro diner decor. I loved it!  So my husband got the MOAB or "Mother of all burritos"...PACKED to the brim with onions, eggs, sausage, bacon chorizo breakfast potatoes, you name it. It was the size of his head im not even exaggerating. It was so flavorful. for $9?! SCORE!!!!  I got a chicken fingers basket because i was craving fries. I was kind of upset because they serve shoestring fries and i didnt get what i wanted out of it. The chicken fingers were hand breaded and you can definetly tell the difference. They arent frozen and are steaming hot and fresh!!  I give this place 3 stars because the service was HORRIBLE. Our waitress was like 80, you could tell she didnt want to be bothered  let alone do her job. She moped around, got us our drinks took our order and never came back. The she just handed the receipt to us without even asking if we wanted dessert or anything else. Like shoo'ing us away.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

F5U61xS00oQpWO5vBFxCFw.text: I believe we got there after their rush because the floor was totally trashed.  Although the employees were great about clearing off the tables, they certainly could have taken a broom to the floor; especially since at this point there were only several tables ever occupied while we were there.  Anyhow, I had an omelet with avocado & Asiago.  While the taste was good, I personally prefer a fluffy omelet, whereas theirs are overcooked a bit with a slight brown "burn" to it.  It makes it a bit dry.  Hubby had eggs, ham & pancakes.  He told me how good their ham is and he was right!  Absolutely delicious.  Of course I tried his pancake, too.  Nothing out out of the ordinary, but still good.  Prices are kind of high if you ask me.  Better rating if you would learn to keep the establishment alot cleaner.

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Avocado &amp; Asiago omelet

Ej6UMce4bnvZnHFm0ddY_g.text: Service was very slow. Waitress was yelling across the restaurant to other employees drawing attention to a mishap that customers need not know anything about. It took nearly 45 minutes before we were seen again to place our order. I had the MOAB. The burrito had nearly half of an uncooked onion in it. Along with an entire steamed tomato. The kitchen was not busy as they are in plain view so that isn't a reason for this poor culinary mistake. My wife ordered a sandwich and was given a wrap. All in all I am disappointed in my experience at delucas because people always speak so highly of it. I don't recommend going to this location. Stick to the strip district delucas.

_oZkTSGvfVpPFa0LTOSN5Q.text: Great menu with plenty of options! There's something for everyone. Love the fact you can see the chefs make your meal.  The hash browns were just like my mom used to make. Looking forward to trying the crepes the next time I'm back

i_t9hcETPQjkGUm9YmBoKA.text: We went there today and it was closed.  The posted hours state they are open until 9 but the manager told everyone who wanted to eat there (about 10 or 12 of us) that due to lack of business that they close at 3.  Maybe you should change your hours on here.  He wouldn't let us talk to the owner.  Lack of business?  People kept parking, walking in the door and being turned away.  We got there before 3.

I7MGvqEyjSf-uBswCWHlVQ.text: Stopped by the other day for the first time in the new location. The place was about 1/3 full. We sat in a booth and service was spotty. Biggest question I had was " Who was the brains behind the decision to put the big screen TV above the counter?" We got to watch the "Brittany" show...along with three waitresses and the hostess with their backs to us.   I did finally  get a refill...during a commercial break.  The food was okay... nothing spectacular.  I hear they added a second TV.   Maybe the cooks complained they couldn't see.

5Mp-BDFxgTiKI3OyxU8NIw.text: Great food, great prices generous portions. A super breakfast just 10-15 minutes to the airport.

P5IF7fOy_j5alM7xoT2UtQ.text: I wanted to come here since I had good experiences at the one in the strip but omg. Not the same. It was packed so my mom and I sat at the bar. I ordered the chicken finger basket. When I got my food, the chicken fingers were burnt and the fries were undercooked. They forgot to put my moms order in so she had to watch me eat until she finally got hers. Our waitress was MIA so someone else had to cash us out. Other waitresses were overheard loudly complaining and cussing. Horrible dining experience.

DV7X6nPoJmQs2Sv91VU-ug.text: My wife and I had heard through a mutual friend that the food at Delucas was very good, so we decided to give it a try. We got there to find they were busy so we stood at the small entrance area and waited 10 mins just to put our name in, (which by the way is so small you are bumping elbows with other that are also waiting to be seated).  In the mean time a small group of younger people came in after us and were seated immediately.  Then a party of 8 people were seated, although they had a reserved section, so that we could live with.  Then the hostess called anther group of 2 that had also come in AFTER us. That was the final straw, my wife said that's it and we left.  If I could give no stars at all I would, what an absolutely aggravating experience, we will never go back and will not recommend to anybody.

wp5SL0zZvWkYkprQ25G44A.text: Okay, who needs a 100 year old grill to make awesome food and tasty memories?! Not me! Don't bite me! I get it. The one in downtown was the first and blah, blah. Listen, that's all fine and dandy but new is sometimes better. As soon as you walk in, the smell of non 100 year old establishment is refreshing and the place has a cozy friendly feel to it with very eye catching decor. You won't feel crowded. There's still wide open spaces. They have the BEST WAITRESS IN THE WORLD! Her name is Jamie and she's an absolute doll! All of our breakfast items were delicious! I ordered the pumpkin pancakes with a side of home fries and my hubby ordered the fried chicken and biscuits. EVERYTHING was yummy! The home fries were crispy. The chicken was juicy on the inside and crispy on the outside. The pumpkin pancakes were so fluffy and moist and perfect texture. The bathrooms are in the same level. You don't have to walk down a flight of slimy old stairs to get to them. Alright, enough said. Just stop by and experience it for yourself.

dQQBgIPPWatXZwiy8AiI0g.text: Stopped by with our children our waitress I believe her name was Jamie, regardless the blond short waitress. What a disaster had to continuously send our food back because of it being wrong, when we told JAMIE we got nothing but eye rolls,arguments, and attitude. Last I checked I am the customer and could care less about your petty excuses for my order being wrong. If JAMIE would ha e handled the situation better than maybe I would have considered giving you another shot. Not to mention everytime JAMIE walked away from our table she muttered bitch, cunt, asshole etc. To any waitress that would listen as they stared us down and she slammed plates around. The way JAMIE acted was horrendous not only in a business environment but in front of our children nonetheless. DISPICABLE

fAuMQ9JJS-Ad9qi4bllaTA.text: Unfortunately I cannot even comment on the food since I never got to see the menu or sit at a table. The front service was HORRIBLE. Slow, slow, slow. At least 5 families were waiting with 3 tables cleared. And when I say cleared, I mean wiped down with the same rag without being washed out. Everyone waiting was complaining about the wait and incompetence of the two people taking names and cleaning the tables. If you are looking for a diner experience that has some pep in their step to seat you, this is not the place to go.

nqZ7cPZCahncNEKJ17sDfg.text: Three of us went to Deluca's in Robinson for brunch on a Saturday. When we arrived, we were seated in a booth immediately. A waitress came over and said that our waitress was "indisposed" but would be with us soon. It took about 10-15 minutes for our waitress to appear and take our order. She returned several times to refill our drinks. We soon noticed tables of other customers getting their food, as we still had not gotten ours.  We waited patiently. Still our waitress came and refilled our cups without saying anything about our meals. After noticing a table of 7 guys who came 30 minutes after us, all getting huge plates of food, we asked. "Where was our food? We had been waiting over an hour." She said she'd check. We watched her go to the counter, frantically go through her book of checks, obviously searching for our check. She seemed to have an argument with one of the cooks. Then she went to several other tables, speaking to customers, taking orders, etc... She finally returned to our table and explained that our order was lost. She said she didn't lose it, but it got lost somehow. She also said that they would "comp" our meal. I said we were planning to order dessert too, were they going to comp that as well? She said she'd ask. She came back and said they would not comp our desserts, but instead give us a $5 gift card but we were not allowed to use it on this day.  It still took about 20 minutes to get our meals. When they came, two of us ordered French fries. She explained that they were out of French fries. At this point, it was almost two hours since we ordered, and when we ordered, they were not out of French fries. So they gave us onion rings instead, not even what we wanted. After we ate, we got up and left. My husband left the waitress a $10 tip. I think she did not deserve any tip, as any good waitress should have noticed that after 15-20 minutes we should have had our food, and checked herself. She should not have waited for her customers to ask her where their food was after more than an hour passed. As we were crossing the parking lot, our waitress yelled out the door that we forgot our $5 gift card. We yelled back that we did not want it. We would never return there again--ever. No amount on any gift card could entice us to come back to a place like that with such awful service.If I could give this a negative rating, I would. A 1 is too generous.

FVIAx7ffAr6MxR0FTeEhbg.text: Got a breakfast burrito. It was one of the better breakfast burritos I've had but the sauce that they put on it was disgusting. The menu called it Spanish style but it was more like watered down ketchup. Next time I'm definitely asking them to hold the sauce. Service was quick although I wouldn't necessarily call my waitress friendly. She was a bit snippy and seemed angry that we needed more time to look at the menu. We were there on a weekday morning and the place was fairly empty so I'm not sure why she was upset that we weren't ready to order the second we sat down. The woman who cashed us out when we went up to pay was nice and gave us a coupon for $1 off our next visit when I donated to the charity bucket at the register. Good food, adequate if slightly surly service, plenty of options for brunch? We'll be back someday. Not good enough to be worth fighting weekend crowds bit this might be our new weekday breakfast place.

AvfDCVsEWD6B3EH3CBUFXg.text: Terrible service, food not worth the price.   We waited for 20 minutes before the server took our order, and then another half hour for a salad. The whole place is filthy, but the service is absolutely abhorrent.

IffA4WEege9vlSqDVd4ZuQ.text: After a bit of Christmas shopping we decided to stop here for a late lunch. A very nice hostess seated us in a comfortable booth. Having never visited DeLuca's for lunch, we ask the friendly waitress for some sandwich recommendations. We chose the first one she recommended--the Philly Steak & Cheese on a delicious Mancini's roll, with coleslaw and Cajun fries. We were NOT disappointed! The steak was delicious and perfectly cooked as we requested! Very tasty and filling!!! The coleslaw was fresh, cool, crisp--and delicious. The Cajun fries added extra zing to an already yummy meal. No complaints whatsoever! We were more than satisfied--and FULL!!! Considering it was near closing time, we weren't made to feel rushed at all. We are definitely looking forward to a return trip to this cool, friendly and clean diner in the near future!

7bNlQwK2TogPcUxpC7nDiQ.text: Despite all the hoopla, I can't say I was thrilled. Pros: they had a very friendly staff, the healthier option of buckwheat pancakes/waffles, and the French toast was on point. Cons: frozen strawberries, fake whipped cream, sub-par hash, and the absolute worst was the sausage. I'm 99% sure it was ground beef mixed with sausage at a respective 90:10 ratio. My friends and I will be sticking to Pamela's.

xijqWVxTYi8ILyvFpAJ1cQ.text: One of the best breakfast joints in Pittsburgh is now open in Robinson (across the street from IKEA). Awesome service,  incredible food and huge portions round out my favorite new breakfast spot. Pancakes are massive and HOMEMADE (not a store bought mix, like most places). Bacon is nice and crispy and is great on your breakfast plate or your BLT! The huge menu can't be beat, so if you can't find something to fit your fancy here... check your pulse. Huge thumbs up!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Home fries

Lo3E38mQB4zhKq8B5VCubg.text: This was my first visit. I've always heard amazing things about Deluca's, so we were excited to dine there. After my friend ordered a coffee, we noticed that they kept the dairy creamer on the table. In fact, they were on all the tables. Although this was unsanitary, I could honestly look past it if they're being changed often. Well, when he opened the container, we noticed mold on the inside of it. When my friend asked our server, Jess, for more cream, she took it, filled up the SAME container & brought it back. She clearly didn't pay attention to it.  Our server, Jess, was not personable and barely stuck around to see if we had everything we needed. They really weren't busy, this was post lunch rush. I ordered a breakfast meal... Jess brought our food and my pancakes were still going to take a minute, which is absolutely fine. However, I watched my pancakes come up in the window and sit there for 8-10 min while Jess sat at a table and talked to 2 men. She even went back to the window while the pancakes were sitting there and ran other food. She totally forgot about them. When she finally did bring them to the table, they were luke warm. Needless to say, I was very unsatisfied. The rest of the food was decent, though.  What Jess didn't realize is that she was waiting on 2 people in the food industry (my friend is a manager & I'm a server). I could have forgiven all of the mishaps if I felt like Jess honestly cared about our visit. No one is perfect & mistakes happen, but she showed no remorse and consideration for us. I will not be returning to this location.

rr6kIRGVdCibkMr9ATT0hg.text: One of my favorite places to eat breakfast, hearty portions and just plain good food. Their omelettes are huge and delicious, been there over a dozen times haven't had a less than great meal yet!

OyQLTedtBBgg5shHksWR0A.text: We got seated quickly and the waitress was awesome! She helped us pick something on the menu and it was awesome! You have to get the burrito!

lgGabR8V0LCihbMxzTMOnA.text: Had the seafood omelette, it was great. Sat at the diner and the waitress was very friendly & nice. Refilled my coffee promptly. I would definitely return for breakfast again.

1iJVz2hv6YsJXUVCVdZ9YQ.text: Went in around 2:15 pm to get lunch. We didn't realize they closed at 3. They seated us and everyone was polite. The food was ok. Food was maybe 2-2.5 stars out of 5. The entire 35 minutes we were there the 8 or so workers sat 1 table over from us and spent the entire time trashing another coworker and other customers. They were so loud we could hardly hold our own conversation. It was awkward. They were counting the money, mopping all around us and sweeping huge piles of mess by our table as we ate. Such an awful experience and with the food not being that good, I probably won't be back.

A5KupR6uYkAOz8TzMMHlRQ.text: While the severs themselves have gotten noticeably better, the kitchen staff is still lacking. On 2 different occasions my MOAB breakfast burrito has been served without meat. The meals have been coming out cold and staggered, whereas some of your party will be half way done before everyone gets their food.

TGIKQI1atcwjAIKV3K_LCw.text: Awesome food, great environment for a weekend breakfast diner. Service is good, with friendly people.  Every item on this menu is fantastic.  I love their breakfast burrito, they have a great Western omelette, chocolate chip pancakes are light and fluffy topped with powder sugar, some loose chocolate chips, and just the right amount of chocolate melted inside that theyre not too sweet, but syrup unnecessary.  They have great coffee, which for coffee snobs like me and my girlfriend, a good breakfast place has to have.  We have been down to the one in the Pittsburgh's Strip District which is the original, however with the seating a little small, and the line usually wrapping down the sidewalk on weekends, we decided to try the Robinson one which is located in the Robinson Town Centre in the Plaza across from the IKEA and next to the IKEA pickup center.  This location seems to be setup better seating wise, and with the added ability to check -in and then wait in your car or the benches they have out front, much more comfortable than the strip district location. If you're headed out to the Robinson Town Centre to do some shopping and find yourself looking for a place to have breakfast, forget IHOP or Eat'nPark check out DeLucas!

photos.caption: Photo of DeLuca's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Classic!

lfDqg6XoH7gWxM0Kg36aAg.text: We had been wanting to try Deluca's since they opened. Today we got our chance. It was a complete disappointment. We ordered the mixed grill, vegetables were steamed and tasteless.  We also ordered a breakfast burrito with chorizo sausage. It was overcooked and almost inedible. We also got the chicken fried chicken, eggs, and biscuits which was the only saving grace to the meal. I believe our first time at Deluca's will be our last. There are too many other better choices in Robinson to waste money there again. What a disappointment.

024WncQe5ThS_av22-yC2A.text: We brought in friend's from out of town after talking about how wonderful this place was....never again will we come. We are still sitting here an hour later and have had to request...TEN...yes TEN forgotten ordered items at least three times. As we were paying our bill our waitress, Mary, brought over the eggs and bacon that she already charged us for...:-(

JDDZNCfQ1tPru6SbA533_A.text: Ah it was ok.  The hostess wasn't very friendly. She silently led us to our table. This was probably the cheapest dinner out we've had ever. Got the turkey club and it was tiny, but had a good, buttery top and bottom. My husband wanted the hot turkey sandwich which was on the menu, but was told it wasn't "real" turkey so the waitress advised against getting. He settled for the bacon cheeseburger.  The diner is small and sort of a dirty vibe, but the bathrooms were clean!

mUI6ar4u6tvXlWd3_4TxUA.text: Love diner food! DeLucas steak salad was delicious. Real steak, melted asiago , roasted peppers, sauteed mushrooms and BEER BATTERED onion  Rings, oh my!  Was so good I did not use the ranch dressing I ordered on it!  Friendly staff and clean. Important, I am in the food industry also. First time, I will be back. The seafood crepe is calling my name!

azZ3wKwnYrEaTElxTe1lZA.text: This place totally sucks. We started off with a 45-minute wait after being told it'd be 25. Then we practically had to beg for everything from silverware to coffee to creamer to water. It became clear why the wait was so long. Nobody in there hustles at all. It takes at least 20 minutes to get anything you ask for - and we're not talking about food yet.  I got a bacon and cheese omelet. I was lucky. I actually got my food. When confronted with all the missing parts and pieces of my dining companions' orders, the waitress looked at each of them as if it was the first time she was hearing their requests.  The bacon in my omelet was not in pieces, but whole strips which wouldn't have been so bad had it been cooked. It came out of the omelet like the birth scene from alien - long, fatty, wiggly strips of greasy, rubbery, grey fat. Disgusting and inedible.  Breakfast took almost two hours in total and everybody was disappointed in their food. There are too many other good places to go. Won't waste our time (or money) again.

HZgHw_Oe-MbcRS6NJBpZVA.text: Such a great place for food that is like making it from scratch! U won't be disappointed going here! Go early it gets busy cause it's that good.

tRzFGAfYoq5fxxhd8MzpqQ.text: Went in with a friend late on a Saturday morning. Coffee had that left on the burner too long, acidy taste. The food, standard breakfast items, was off. Scrambled eggs arrived more like an overdone omelette. Toast was cold. Almost $3 for my friend's glass of OJ was the final insult. So disappointed because I've enjoyed several good meals at deLuca's in the Strip District.

rRqkFkDIR7CqCcGXcFPyDA.text: Do you like hot garbage and rude service? If you do then come here to eat. Food is not cooked properly. If you ask for anything cooked more, they become very upset.  I have never had such a bad experience. If I were to describe it in one  word it would be DISGUSTING!!

dM1iHXbKNuKA3kXOmzL0JA.text: Had sea food omelette and it was really good. Portion size was humongous. All of us loved it. Probably not the healthiest thing to eat but if you are in a mood to just go hog.. this is the place to go.
